data.title: DO NOT STAY HERE
data.text: This is the worse place we have ever stayed, arrived back from a trip to find our door wide open, no apologies. On first night no tv, dirty room found nuts in drawer so obviously not checked, staff extremely rude and unhelpful. We will never return

data.title: Illusion
data.text:
It was all an illusion...Outside looks nice...inside terrible.

Tired when I first walked into the room didn't notice just how bad it was.

First, I saw s jacuzzi tub was excited, however to my disappointment it did not work.

Attempted to call the front desk, however, when I tried to use the telephone in the room, the telephone had no dial tone, inspected the telephone further, just to realize it was just a shell of a phone. (See pictures below).

I then called the front desk from my cell phone, the attendant, told me that there is no access to the line, because of misuse... Isn't this against the law???

The quality of the room, was that of a motel in a destitute neighborhood with the price of a Travel lodge or Best Western.
.
You may wonder why we continued to stay the night? Tired, not feeling well, out of town and needed to rest.

Said a prayer and went to sleep.

data.title: ughhh!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
data.text:
I was in LA on an emergency and did not check any review on this place. Walked in and asked about the rooms and if available. The manager looked up at me with a scowl on his face like I was seriously disturbing him and the look of disapproval. No welcome, no how may help you, I know this look so I did not take it on I just wanted a place to sleep for a few hours because I anticipated I would be out for most of the time.  He sent me to look at a room but there were people in it, he even gave me the key. Luckily the guests were leaving and the door was open so I got a glimpse, I paid for a room and left. When I returned later and opened the door the room kicked with such a stench, I put the AC on to cool things down a little, there was a damp spot on the floor between the bed and the fridge. Every time I walk by my foot would stick to the carpet. I opened the bedside draw to put some items in it I was greeted with a box of open condoms and wrappe! The AC blows directly on the bed with no adjustment so at some time in the night it became very uncomfortable, I took the chair and put my suitcase on it in front of the vent to redirect the airflow. The man upstairs had to be doing P90X because I could hear him; every step he took was so noisy. My left arm started to itch the first night and after the second night a rash broke , that was it, I seriously know how to rough it, I am a scuba instructor and have been in some places before. I can take a beating but this was totally ridiculous to pay for it, I stayed two nights and that was it, and he still charged for 3 ontop of that. When it was time to do a refund he charged the card instead of reversing it, leaving me with $1000.00 US less on my card because it would take 10 days for  the charges  reverse.

All in all don't stay here!!!! There are many other options in Torrance which I found just by driving around, I would highly recommend Travelodge on Sepulveda Blvd. and higher up from Cali Inn there is Econolodge if you have to stay in the area.

data.title: DO NOT STAY HERE!
data.text: This place was terrible. As soon as I walked into my room, I could hear the people on either side of me talking and their TVs. The walls were so painfully thin that I knew I would not be able to sleep that night. I requested a different room from the manager. He told me they only had larger rooms available and that I had to pay an additional fee to switch to one of those rooms. After some push back from me, he asked if I wanted a refund and I said yes. Any hotel manager that is willing to refund my money rather than simply switch my room is crazy in my opinion, but I'm glad I got my money back and was able to get the hell outta there. I stayed at the Econolodge a couple miles down the road. The area of Carson is not a nice place in general, but at least the walls were thicker at Econolodge, and they provided breakfast.

data.title: Disappointing and Worst Inn ever
data.text: I was very disappointed. The front desk was unkind, unfriendly and disrespectful. When we check in, she asked us to pay for the whole stay. When we checked the room it was very smelly, uncomfortable, and the beddings were dirty. When we checked the bathroom, there is no water in the shower and there is no flush in the toilet. We complaint to another front desk about that but he asked us to do it. He taught us how fix it. So we decided to just leave and find another hotel. We asked the front desk to refund our money because we didn't stay in that room at all but he charged us $50 for no valid reason. Worst Inn ever. Very disgusting. I would not recommend this inn.

data.title: Worst Room ever
data.text: Where do I start!!!!  The front desk manager was mean and very unfriendly; upon openning the the room door the smell of urinal hit me in the face like baseball.  While in the room a lollipop stick was left on the floor by the maids; the micro-mini fridg was filthy; the bathroom was filthy and smelly with gential hairs in the tub.  The motel look like a place for prostitutes.  We wanted a refund, but knew that would not happen by the manager's attitude.  First, we bought Lysol and other cleansers to disinfect the room for our one night stay.  If I knew the area better, I would have left without a refund to be more comfortable. We just needed a place to sleep after a late night event.  Thank God the event was somewhere else.  This is the Worst Room ever that I stayed in. We were only missing the roaches and rats to be in a worse dump.

data.title: Una porqueria
data.text: Aaaaaahhhhhhh no se queden en este hotel es una porqueria hay mucha actividad de pandillas los managers son nobte tratan bien (indians) la que limpia los cuartos no hace su trabajo bien un pesimo servicio no vengan a quedarse a este hotel horrible el trato al cliente
